intro: Chasme pinifolia, commonly known as the needle-leaved chasme, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, needle-like leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common floral arrangement in the carrot family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Chasme pinifolia is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
